info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 8:28PM MDT until June 11 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTY... At 827 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Clayton Lake State Park, or 20 miles northwest of Clayton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clayton Lake State Park, Seneca and Moses. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. High winds and large hail can spread quickly across open rangeland. Boaters should take refuge at the nearest protected shoreline.
